verses.kjv: In the three and twentieth year of Joash the son of Ahaziah king of Judah Jehoahaz the son of Jehu began to reign over Israel in Samaria, and reigned seventeen years.
verses.web: In the twenty-third year of Joash the son of Ahaziah, king of Judah, Jehoahaz the son of Jehu began to reign over Israel in Samaria for seventeen years.
verses.ct: Jehoahaz son of Jehu became king of Israel in Samaria during the 23rd year of King Joash son of Ahaziah of Judah. He ruled for 17 years.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, and followed the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, which made Israel to sin; he departed not therefrom.
verses.web: He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight, and followed the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin. He didn’t depart from it.
verses.ct: He did evil in the LORD's sight, following the same sinful path that Jeroboam son of Nebat had set for Israel — and he never turned from it.

verses.kjv: And the anger of the LORD was kindled against Israel, and he delivered them into the hand of Hazael king of Syria, and into the hand of Benhadad the son of Hazael, all their days.
verses.web: LORD’s anger burned against Israel, and he delivered them into the hand of Hazael king of Syria, and into the hand of Benhadad the son of Hazael, continually.
verses.ct: So the LORD's anger burned against Israel, and he handed them over to King Hazael of Syria and his son Benhadad again and again.

verses.kjv: And Jehoahaz besought the LORD, and the LORD hearkened unto him: for he saw the oppression of Israel, because the king of Syria oppressed them.
verses.web: Jehoahaz begged LORD, and LORD listened to him; for he saw the oppression of Israel, how the king of Syria oppressed them.
verses.ct: But Jehoahaz cried out to the LORD, and the LORD listened to him, because he saw how brutally the king of Syria was oppressing Israel.

verses.kjv: (And the LORD gave Israel a saviour, so that they went out from under the hand of the Syrians: and the children of Israel dwelt in their tents, as beforetime.
verses.web: (LORD gave Israel a savior, so that they went out from under the hand of the Syrians; and the children of Israel lived in their tents as before.
verses.ct: (The LORD provided a deliverer for Israel, and they escaped from Syrian control. The Israelites were able to live in their own homes again, just as before.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless they departed not from the sins of the house of Jeroboam, who made Israel sin, but walked therein: and there remained the grove also in Samaria.)
verses.web: Nevertheless they didn’t depart from the sins of the house of Jeroboam, with which he made Israel to sin, but walked in them; and the Asherah also remained in Samaria.)
verses.ct: Even so, they never abandoned the sins that Jeroboam's dynasty had led Israel into. They kept right on sinning, and the Asherah pole still stood in Samaria.)

verses.kjv: Neither did he leave of the people to Jehoahaz but fifty horsemen, and ten chariots, and ten thousand footmen; for the king of Syria had destroyed them, and had made them like the dust by threshing.
verses.web: For he didn’t leave to Jehoahaz of the people any more than fifty horsemen, and ten chariots, and ten thousand footmen; for the king of Syria destroyed them, and made them like the dust in threshing.
verses.ct: Jehoahaz's army had been reduced to almost nothing — just 50 horsemen, 10 chariots, and 10,000 foot soldiers. The king of Syria had crushed them, grinding them down like dust on a threshing floor.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoahaz, and all that he did, and his might, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoahaz, and all that he did, and his might, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.ct: Everything else about Jehoahaz's reign — all he did and his achievements — is recorded in the official history of Israel's kings.

verses.kjv: And Jehoahaz slept with his fathers; and they buried him in Samaria: and Joash his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Jehoahaz slept with his fathers; and they buried him in Samaria; and Joash his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Jehoahaz died and was buried in Samaria. His son Joash succeeded him as king.

verses.kjv: In the thirty and seventh year of Joash king of Judah began Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz to reign over Israel in Samaria, and reigned sixteen years.
verses.web: In the thirty-seventh year of Joash king of Judah, Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz began to reign over Israel in Samaria for sixteen years.
verses.ct: Jehoash son of Jehoahaz became king of Israel in Samaria during the 37th year of King Joash of Judah. He ruled for 16 years.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD; he departed not from all the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel sin: but he walked therein.
verses.web: He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight. He didn’t depart from all the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin; but he walked in them.
verses.ct: He did evil in the LORD's sight. He never turned away from any of the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had led Israel into — he continued in all of them.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the acts of Joash, and all that he did, and his might wherewith he fought against Amaziah king of Judah, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Joash, and all that he did, and his might with which he fought against Amaziah king of Judah, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.ct: Everything else about Joash's reign — all he did and his military campaigns against King Amaziah of Judah — is recorded in the official history of Israel's kings.

verses.kjv: And Joash slept with his fathers; and Jeroboam sat upon his throne: and Joash was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel.
verses.web: Joash slept with his fathers; and Jeroboam sat on his throne. Joash was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel.
verses.ct: Joash died and was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel. Jeroboam took the throne after him.

verses.kjv: Now Elisha was fallen sick of his sickness whereof he died. And Joash the king of Israel came down unto him, and wept over his face, and said, O my father, my father, the chariot of Israel, and the horsemen thereof.
verses.web: Now Elisha became sick with the illness of which he died; and Joash the king of Israel came down to him, and wept over him, and said, “My father, my father, the chariots of Israel and its horsemen!”
verses.ct: Elisha was dying. King Joash of Israel came to see him, wept over him, and cried out, "My father! My father! The chariots and horsemen of Israel!"

verses.kjv: And Elisha said unto him, Take bow and arrows. And he took unto him bow and arrows.
verses.web: Elisha said to him, “Take bow and arrows;” and he took bow and arrows for himself.
verses.ct: Elisha told him, "Get a bow and some arrows." So the king got them.

verses.kjv: And he said to the king of Israel, Put thine hand upon the bow. And he put his hand upon it: and Elisha put his hands upon the king’s hands.
verses.web: He said to the king of Israel, “Put your hand on the bow;” and he put his hand on it. Elisha laid his hands on the king’s hands.
verses.ct: "Put your hand on the bow," Elisha said. The king gripped it, and Elisha placed his own hands over the king's hands.

verses.kjv: And he said, Open the window eastward. And he opened it. Then Elisha said, Shoot. And he shot. And he said, The arrow of the LORD’s deliverance, and the arrow of deliverance from Syria: for thou shalt smite the Syrians in Aphek, till thou have consumed them.
verses.web: He said, “Open the window eastward;” and he opened it. Then Elisha said, “Shoot!” and he shot. He said, “LORD’s arrow of victory, even the arrow of victory over Syria; for you will strike the Syrians in Aphek, until you have consumed them.”
verses.ct: "Open the east window," Elisha said. He opened it. "Now shoot!" Elisha commanded. He shot. Then Elisha declared, "That is the LORD's arrow of victory — the arrow of victory over Syria! You will defeat the Syrians at Aphek until you have completely destroyed them."

verses.kjv: And he said, Take the arrows. And he took them. And he said unto the king of Israel, Smite upon the ground. And he smote thrice, and stayed.
verses.web: He said, “Take the arrows;” and he took them. He said to the king of Israel, “Strike the ground;” and he struck three times, and stopped.
verses.ct: Then Elisha said, "Pick up the arrows." He picked them up. "Now strike the ground," Elisha told the king. He struck the ground 3 times and stopped.

verses.kjv: And the man of God was wroth with him, and said, Thou shouldest have smitten five or six times; then hadst thou smitten Syria till thou hadst consumed it: whereas now thou shalt smite Syria but thrice.
verses.web: The man of God was angry with him, and said, “You should have struck five or six times. Then you would have struck Syria until you had consumed it; whereas now you will strike Syria just three times.”
verses.ct: The prophet was furious. "You should have struck 5 or 6 times! Then you would have completely destroyed Syria. Now you will only defeat them 3 times."

verses.kjv: And Elisha died, and they buried him. And the bands of the Moabites invaded the land at the coming in of the year.
verses.web: Elisha died, and they buried him. Now the bands of the Moabites invaded the land at the coming in of the year.
verses.ct: Elisha died and was buried. That spring, Moabite raiding parties began invading the land.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as they were burying a man, that, behold, they spied a band of men; and they cast the man into the sepulchre of Elisha: and when the man was let down, and touched the bones of Elisha, he revived, and stood up on his feet.
verses.web: As they were burying a man, behold, they saw a band of raiders; and they threw the man into Elisha’s tomb. As soon as the man touched Elisha’s bones, he revived, and stood up on his feet.
verses.ct: One day, some people were burying a man when they spotted a raiding party approaching. They quickly threw the body into Elisha's tomb. The moment the man's body touched Elisha's bones, he came back to life and stood up on his feet.

verses.kjv: But Hazael king of Syria oppressed Israel all the days of Jehoahaz.
verses.web: Hazael king of Syria oppressed Israel all the days of Jehoahaz.
verses.ct: King Hazael of Syria oppressed Israel throughout the entire reign of Jehoahaz.

verses.kjv: And the LORD was gracious unto them, and had compassion on them, and had respect unto them, because of his covenant with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and would not destroy them, neither cast he them from his presence as yet.
verses.web: But LORD was gracious to them, and had compassion on them, and had respect for them, because of his covenant with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and would not destroy them, and he didn’t cast them from his presence as yet.
verses.ct: But the LORD was gracious and compassionate toward Israel. Because of his covenant with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, he refused to destroy them or banish them from his presence — not yet.

verses.kjv: So Hazael king of Syria died; and Benhadad his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Hazael king of Syria died; and Benhadad his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: When King Hazael of Syria died, his son Benhadad succeeded him.

verses.kjv: And Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz took again out of the hand of Benhadad the son of Hazael the cities, which he had taken out of the hand of Jehoahaz his father by war. Three times did Joash beat him, and recovered the cities of Israel.
verses.web: Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz took again out of the hand of Benhadad the son of Hazael the cities which he had taken out of the hand of Jehoahaz his father by war. Joash struck him three times, and recovered the cities of Israel.
verses.ct: Then Jehoash son of Jehoahaz recaptured from Benhadad son of Hazael all the cities that Benhadad had taken from his father Jehoahaz in battle. Joash defeated him 3 times and recovered the Israelite cities.
